intro: Heptapleurum subavene var. brachybotrya, commonly known as the broad-leafed heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its large, leathery, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. The plant produces small, white, clustered flowers that are often followed by small, round berries. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture for its attractive foliage.
